plugins.name: Adapture by INKR
plugins.description:
Adapture makes it easy to adapt your designs for new markets—right inside Figma. By understanding your content and layout, it rewrites and translates text that fits seamlessly into your design and speaks to your audience.


No broken layouts, no manual fixes—just content that works.


Why Designers Love Adapture:


  1. Effortless Adaptation: Select your frames, set your goals, and let Adapture handle the rest. It rewrites and translates text while keeping your layout intact.
  2. Smarter Translations: Adapture analyzes your design and messaging to deliver text that matches the tone, intent, and purpose of your work.
  3. Consistent Messaging: Whether you’re creating for new audiences or adapting for different markets, Adapture helps you keep your messaging aligned and on-brand.
  4. Saves Time: Automates the heavy lifting so you can focus on creating, not fixing.


Key Features:


  1. Design-Aware Adaptation: Adapture understands your designs and rewrites text to fit your layout, intent, and audience.
  2. Cultural Customization: Adapt for new markets with sensitivity to language, tone, and local nuances.
  3. Built for Designers: Works right inside Figma, so you can adapt and update designs without disrupting your workflow.
  4. Seamless Integration: Keeps your layouts clean and intact, saving you time and effort.


Perfect For:


  1. Designers creating multilingual or culturally tailored content.
  2. Teams expanding into new markets or working across global audiences.
  3. Anyone who wants to streamline design adaptation without sacrificing quality.


----

Currently in Closed Beta


Adapture is available in closed beta. You can request an invitation code directly from the plugin to start adapting your designs today.
plugins.tagline: Make Your Designs Work for Any Audience

plugins.name: AutoFrame
plugins.description:
AutoFrame: Connect Airtable Data to Your Figma Designs


Bridge the gap between your data and your designs! Autoframe allows you to seamlessly connect your Airtable bases directly to Figma, automating the creation and synchronization of design elements.


Stop manually copying and pasting data. With Autoframe, you can generate perfectly structured Figma frames populated with real content from your Airtable views, saving you time and reducing errors.


Key Features:

  1. Secure Airtable Connection: Easily connect your Airtable account using a secure OAuth 2.0 flow.
  2. Automated Frame Generation: Select an Airtable Base, Table, and View, and instantly generate Figma frames for each record.
  3. Data-Driven Content: Choose specific Airtable fields to populate text layers within your frames, ensuring your designs reflect your actual data.
  4. Custom Frame Naming: Designate an Airtable field to automatically name your generated frames.
  5. Dynamic Frame Sizing: Optionally add a "Dimensions" field (e.g., 300x500) in your Airtable view to automatically set the width and height of corresponding Figma frames.
  6. Flexible Layout: Control the arrangement of generated frames by specifying the number of columns.
  7. Figma to Airtable: Push text edits or frame name changes made in Figma back to your Airtable base.
  8. Airtable to Figma: Pull the latest data from Airtable to update your existing generated frames without needing to regenerate everything.
  9. Secure Login: Protects access via an Email + One-Time Passcode (OTP) verification system.


How It Works:

  1. Connect: Log in and securely connect your Airtable account.
  2. Select: Choose your Airtable Base, Table, View, and the fields you want to use for frame names and content.
  3. Generate: Click "Generate Frames" to automatically create frames on your Figma canvas populated with your data.
  4. Sync: Use the "Sync Changes to Airtable" or "Sync From Airtable" buttons to keep your designs and data aligned.


Ideal For:

  1. Data-driven design workflows
  2. Managing dynamic content within designs (e.g., user profiles, product cards)
  3. Populating components for design systems
  4. Quickly visualizing data structures from Airtable
  5. Anyone looking to streamline their design process by integrating directly with Airtable.


Get started with AutoFrame today and bring your Airtable data to life in Figma!
plugins.tagline: Autoframe: The Bridge Between Airtable and Figma.

plugins.description:
Designmate! is your design thinking sidekick – built right into Figma.


Instead of vague scores or generic advice, Designmate! gives you concrete, context-aware feedback based on real user needs. Just drop in a screen, describe what the user is trying to do, and instantly get personalized suggestions to make your UI more usable, accessible, and delightful.


✨ What you’ll get:


  1. A clear explanation of what’s not working from a user’s perspective


  1. Specific UI/UX fixes, with exact actions to improve the screen


  1. Feedback on clarity, hierarchy, accessibility, copy, buttons, layout & more


  1. Zero BS, zero ego – just real product thinking in your Figma flow


Perfect for solo designers, founders, PMs, or teams looking to improve fast without overthinking it.

plugins.name: Lighthouse
plugins.description:
Lighthouse helps designers check Lottie animation compatibility across iOS, Android, and Web. It scans Figma frames, detects unsupported features like shadows, blurs, etc., and lists issues directly on affected layers. Double-click to jump to problem layers and get instant updates as you fix them—ensuring a smooth animation workflow.


How to Use Lighthouse:

1️⃣ Select a Frame – Open Lighthouse and choose a frame to analyze.

2️⃣ Instant Issue Detection – View a list of unsupported animation features.

3️⃣ Quick Fix Navigation – Double-click an issue to select the affected layer.

4️⃣ Live Updates – Changes update instantly as you fix issues.

5️⃣ Final Check & Export – Ensure compatibility for seamless Lottie animations.

6️⃣ Mark frames – Mark frames that are ready for animation to avoid confusion and ensure efficient workflow.


Simplify your motion design process with Lighthouse! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Instantly detect unsupported Lottie features in Figma for seamless cross-platform animations.

Detect Design Inconsistencies: Scan multiple frames for discrepancies in font styles, colors, buttons, iconography(coming soon), spacing, and navigation elements(coming soon) etc.


Get Visual Feedback: Receive clear, color-coded tags indicating inconsistencies, with direct frame references and numerical comparisons for easy analysis.


Streamline Workflow(coming soon): Highlight design issues directly in the UI, allowing users to click and focus on problematic frames, helping maintain design system integrity across projects.


To use the Consistify plugin, follow these steps:


Open your design in Figma.

Select at least 2 frames you want to compare for inconsistencies.

Run the Plugin

plugins.name: Codex — Repository-Aware Code Generator powered by AI
plugins.description:
Codex is an AI powered code generator that learns your existing repo. You can import your repository, and Codex will generate code in your used framework, using your styles and configurations. It works with any framework or language. No setup necessary — just import with one click and go!


Features


Code just like you wrote it yourself

Codex will adapt its code generation to the conventions and code style used across your repo. It will read config files and use the same libraries and frameworks you use in your project.


Refine your export further

Need to use a specific component? Instruct Codex to change your code and get a refined result, without losing the context. You can also do this multiple times, until you’re 100% happy.


Learns your repository with a one-click-import

You don’t have to map your figma components to your design system. Codex automatically recognizes which components you have implemented or installed and will use those for generating code.


Generates code in any framework or language

Any language, library or framework you are using in your repo will be used by Codex to generate code from Figma.


Learns from your feedback

As you refine your exports, Codex will remember your feedback and apply it to future code generations.


FAQ


Who is it for?

Codex is targeted at professional front end developers to speed up their workflows.


Does my figma file need special preparation?

No, but it works much better if all frames use auto layout.


Which frameworks are supported?

Codex is framework-agnostic. This means it can generate code in any language, for any framework. However, popular frameworks like React and Vue work best, as LLMs have more training data on them.


Can I use it without a repository?

Currently, no. But you can create a repository and initialize it with an empty skeleton in the framework of your choice, then Codex will generate code for that framework.


Does it work with monorepos?

If there is only one frontend package in the repo, likely yes. Better monorepo support is on the roadmap.


Does it only work in dev mode/design mode?

Codex works in both figma modes.


Does it only work with Github?

Currently, yes. Other providers coming soon.


Pricing


Check our pricing page for information on plans.
plugins.tagline: The code generator that understands your repository

plugins.name: PropSelect
plugins.description:
PropSelect enhances your Figma workflow by allowing you to copy and paste specific properties like fill, stroke, and corner radius between elements without overwriting all properties.


Here is a YouTube video summarizing the features and working of this plugin - https://youtu.be/76v9z9xthH0


How it works:

1. Select an element: Click on an element in your design, and its properties will appear in the plugin UI.

2. Choose properties to copy: For each property (e.g., fill, stroke, corner radius), you can select a checkbox to indicate which properties you want to copy. Once you're done, click the copy button to save the selected properties.

3. Paste properties: You can paste the copied properties onto one or more elements at once.


Features:

• Selective property copying: Choose exactly which properties to copy (e.g., fill, stroke, corner radius) to avoid overwriting unwanted styles.

• Multi-object pasting: Apply copied properties to multiple objects simultaneously, saving time when working with multiple elements.

• Compatibility with other methods: You can paste properties copied outside of the plugin directly. Copying properties within plugin will not override that.

• Undo support: Easily undo your last action if something goes wrong.


Tips:

• Use PropSelect to quickly replicate specific properties across multiple objects without affecting other styles.

• Perfect for maintaining consistency in your design while only changing the properties you care about.

• Works well for batch edits where you want to adjust specific properties, like color or stroke width, across many elements.


Known issues:

• Does not copy underline properties or text alignment.

• Will not work on text boxes with different properties applied to individual contents.
plugins.tagline: Copy and paste specific properties of an element

137698.release_notes:
This version includes 2 major updates - 
1. Initially, on copying a property having a 'style' only the raw value of style was getting copied. Now, it will copy the style itself. E.g. on copying a element with fill style `Black`, the value of that style i.e. #000000 was getting copied which is now fixed to paste `Black` as fill style.
2. The stroke property initially did not capture stroke stroke direction (all sides/ top/ left/ custom, etc) and would apply it on all sides. Fixed

Please let me know if you find any bugs or have suggestions to improve.
137698.tagline: Copy and paste specific properties of an element

plugins.name: BulkGen
plugins.description:
BulkGen figma plugin saves you hundreds of hours of doing grunt work. If you're tasked with creating the same design, lots of time with just some data changing — don't wast time doing it manually. Just use bulkgen, it can auto populate your figma designs from a Google Sheet.


Features:

  1. Google Sheet Import: Make sure these are set to public.
  2. CSV Import: Works for local files


How it Works:

  1. Paste your Google Sheets URL
  2. Make sure the dynamic layers in Figma are labelled correctly (ex: firstname would be #firstname)
  3. Select a base template and hit generate, it's that easy.


Use Cases:

  1. Event Banners: Doing the same event in many cities? This will work for that
  2. Certificates: Automate 1000s of certificates in just a few clicks
  3. Wedding Invites: Mail Merge is so oldschool, just use this.
  4. And Many More.


Website: https://bulkgen.app

Help docs: https://ybnco.notion.site/BulkGen-Help-Docs-1905dc1b35f980f0becbe647dfae68d4

plugins.name: Silent Sweep
plugins.description:
Silent Sweep is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly managing concealed elements in your designs. This powerful tool scans your current page, revealing all hidden layers within each frame and artboard.

With its intuitive card-based interface, you can quickly identify and select hidden elements, streamlining your cleanup process.


Key Features:


  1. Instant Detection: Automatically finds all hidden layers on your current page.
  2. Organized View: Displays hidden layers grouped by their parent frames for easy navigation.
  3. Selective Cleanup: Choose which hidden layers to remove with simple checkboxes.
  4. Real-time Updates: Refreshes automatically when you switch pages or make changes.
  5. Efficient Workflow: Helps maintain clean, organized Figma files without tedious manual searching.


Whether you're polishing up a final design or inheriting a complex file, Silent Sweep helps you maintain a tidy workspace. Say goodbye to forgotten hidden layers and hello to cleaner, more manageable Figma projects. Simplify your design process and boost your productivity with Silent Sweep – your personal cleanup assistant in Figma
plugins.tagline: Unveil and Tidy: Your Hidden Layer Ally

plugins.description:
Simple plugin to synchronise translations with strings repository. Allows to push and pull translations from your own server. Works with active selection to speedup parsing processes.


Usage:

Enter connection details and press connect button.

After selection of element press "refresh selection" to get text labels from selection.

Press "pull" to fetch translations from remote server.

Press "apply" to apply translations from selected translations to document selection.

Press "push" to send translations to remote server.

You can search for the currency you want to convert by searching by country name or currency code, or you can extract only numbers.

Only currency symbols and codes can be added separately,

plugins.name: get-antd-token
plugins.description:
# get-antd-token - Ant Design Token 匹配工具


## 简介


get-antd-token 是一个专为设计师和开发者打造的 Figma 插件，帮助您快速匹配 Figma 设计元素与 Ant Design 的设计 Token，实现无缝的设计与开发协作。


## 主要功能


- 🎨 **精准颜色匹配**：选择任意元素，即时获取对应的 Ant Design 颜色 Token

- 💧 **半透明颜色识别**：智能识别半透明颜色，并提供 `rgba(token.colorXXX, 0.x)` 格式的替代方案

- 🔍 **边框与内边距识别**：自动检测元素的圆角和内边距，匹配相应的 borderRadius 和 padding Token

- 📝 **模板管理系统**：支持导入/导出 Token 模板，完全兼容 Ant Design 的主题配置文件

- 🔄 **一键复制**：快速复制 Token 值，轻松粘贴到代码中


## 插件优势


- **提高设计开发效率**：不再需要手动查找颜色代码或测量边距

- **保持设计一致性**：确保使用 Ant Design 官方推荐的 Token

- **简化设计交接**：设计师可以直接提供 Token 名称而非色值

- **支持主题切换**：通过模板管理轻松在不同主题间切换
plugins.tagline: 支持选中figma的元素获取到antd主题色对应的token值

plugins.name: EasyMemo
plugins.description:
EasyMemo is a versatile plugin for creating, editing, and managing text memos within Figma. With EasyMemo, you can easily add colorful sticky notes, shapes with text, and simple text nodes to your canvas, helping to keep your workspace organized.


Key Features:


Memo Creation and Editing: Simply enter your text, select your desired memo type, and create memos effortlessly. You can edit memos directly on the canvas, and updates are reflected in real-time.

Customizable Colors: Choose colors from a preset color palette, allowing you to categorize and prioritize memos. The text color automatically adjusts for optimal readability based on the selected background color.

Easy Management:


Organize Memos in a List: Add memos to a list for better organization. You can update or delete memo texts directly from the list. The list is scrollable and always up-to-date.

Batch Generation: Easily generate all listed memos at once. Just click the "Create Shapes" button, and all memos will be neatly arranged on the canvas.

Efficient Layout: Memos are generated in the center of the viewport, focusing on the most relevant areas. They are neatly arranged to avoid overlap.

User-Friendly Interface: The modern and intuitive design features a clearly laid-out text input area, radio buttons for selecting memo types, a color palette, and a dynamically updating list.

How to Use:


Enter Text: Input your memo content in the text input area.

Select Memo Type: Choose from shapes with text, simple text, or sticky notes using the radio buttons.

Pick a Color: Select a color from the palette to categorize your memos. The selected color applies to the memo background, and the text color adjusts automatically.

Add to List: Press the Enter key to add the memo to the list. You can edit or delete memos directly within the list.

Generate Memos: Click the "Create Shapes" button to generate all memos on the canvas at once. Memos are centered in the viewport and neatly arranged.

EasyMemo is the perfect tool for organizing ideas and feedback within your Figma projects. Whether brainstorming, planning, or collaborating, EasyMemo simplifies memo management and supports you efficiently.
plugins.tagline: メモやテキストをEnterキー押下のみでリスト化して一括でShape,テキスト、Stickyを生成するプラグインです

plugins.name: iconSync
plugins.description:
Simplify your design-to-development workflow by seamlessly integrating Figma with GitHub, ensuring Figma remains your single source of truth.


You can find the implementation in Github


1. Introduction

`icon-sync` is a powerful tool designed to bridge the gap between design and development.

It enables effortless synchronization of icon assets from Figma directly into a GitHub repository.

With minimal setup and a highly intuitive workflow, `icon-sync` ensures that design assets remain version-controlled, up-to-date, and accessible to the entire product team.


2. Why icon-sync?

Managing design assets—especially icons—can become chaotic across growing teams and projects.

Designers work in Figma, while developers often rely on versioned assets stored in GitHub. This disconnect can lead to:


Outdated assets being used in production.

Manual, error-prone handoffs.

Lack of traceability in design changes.


`icon-sync` solves these issues by automating the synchronization of icons from Figma to GitHub, removing the need for repetitive manual exports and uploads.

It aligns the design and engineering workflows and helps establish Figma as the canonical source for icon assets.


3. Features

🎯 One-Click GitHub Integration

Push your icons from Figma to GitHub in a single action. No more file downloads or commit commands.


🧠 Smart Change Detection

Only changed or new icons are processed, ensuring minimal diffs and cleaner version history.


🔁 Automated Pull Request Generation

Every sync automatically generates a pull request containing updated icons and metadata, complete with commit messages and diffs.


4. Installation & Configuration

⚙️ Prerequisites:

Install `icon-sync` Figma plugin

A GitHub access token


Step 1: Install the Plugin

Install the `icon-sync` Figma plugin from the Figma community.


Step 2: GitHub Access Token Setup


To use `icon-sync`, you must provide a GitHub Access Token. There are two options depending on your preference and security requirements:


Option 1: Personal Access Token (Classic)

If you're using a Personal Access Token, make sure to grant the repo.


⚠️ This approach is simple but grants broad access to your repositories. Use with caution if you have sensitive data or multiple repositories under the same account.


Option 2: Fine-Grained Personal Access Token (Recommended)

If you're using a Fine-Grained Access Token, you'll need to specify individual repository permissions, Make sure to select the following:


Contents → `Read and write`

Allows access to files and blobs in the repository, which is required for uploading icons.


Metadata → `Read-only`

Allows the plugin to retrieve basic repository information.


Pull Requests → `Read and write`

Enables the plugin to automatically create and update pull requests.


5. Usage

Once installed and configured, using `icon-sync` is straightforward.


Step 1: Environment Setup

After launching the `icon-sync` plugin, navigate to the **GitHub** tab.


You’ll see several input fields you need to fill out:

Owner – your GitHub username or organization name

API Key – your GitHub access token

Main Branch Name – usually `main` or `master`

Compare Branch Name – a branch to create for the pull request (e.g., `icon/update`)

Repository Name – the target GitHub repository

Store Path – the directory in the repo where icons should be stored (e.g., `icons/`)


Once you complete these fields, you’re ready to import icons.


Note: These settings are saved locally after the first setup, so you won’t need to re-enter them every time you open the plugin.


Step 2: Import Icons from Figma

You have **two options** to import icons from your Figma file:


Option 1: Auto-Import from Current Page

As soon as the plugin launches, it will automatically scan the **current Figma page** and import all icons that are structured as components.


Option 2: Frame-Based Import

Alternatively, you can:


1. Create a Frame in your Figma file.

2. Select the Frame.

3. Click the "Import Icons" button in the plugin.


This will import only the icons within the selected Frame.


Step 3: Deploy to GitHub

Once you've finished both steps above, you're ready to deploy your icons to GitHub.


Click the Deploy button to start the upload process.

`icon-sync` will automatically commit the icons and open a pull request in your repository.

After deployment, a "Go to GitHub" button will appear. Click it to jump directly to the pull request and review the changes.
plugins.tagline: Sync icons from Figma to GitHub

131205.name: iconSync
131205.description:
Simplify your design-to-development workflow by seamlessly integrating Figma with GitHub, ensuring Figma remains your single source of truth.


You can find the implementation in Github


1. Introduction

`icon-sync` is a powerful tool designed to bridge the gap between design and development.

It enables effortless synchronization of icon assets from Figma directly into a GitHub repository.

With minimal setup and a highly intuitive workflow, `icon-sync` ensures that design assets remain version-controlled, up-to-date, and accessible to the entire product team.


2. Why icon-sync?

Managing design assets—especially icons—can become chaotic across growing teams and projects.

Designers work in Figma, while developers often rely on versioned assets stored in GitHub. This disconnect can lead to:


Outdated assets being used in production.

Manual, error-prone handoffs.

Lack of traceability in design changes.


`icon-sync` solves these issues by automating the synchronization of icons from Figma to GitHub, removing the need for repetitive manual exports and uploads.

It aligns the design and engineering workflows and helps establish Figma as the canonical source for icon assets.


3. Features

🎯 One-Click GitHub Integration

Push your icons from Figma to GitHub in a single action. No more file downloads or commit commands.


🧠 Smart Change Detection

Only changed or new icons are processed, ensuring minimal diffs and cleaner version history.


🔁 Automated Pull Request Generation

Every sync automatically generates a pull request containing updated icons and metadata, complete with commit messages and diffs.


4. Installation & Configuration

⚙️ Prerequisites:

Install `icon-sync` Figma plugin

A GitHub access token


Step 1: Install the Plugin

Install the `icon-sync` Figma plugin from the Figma community.


Step 2: GitHub Access Token Setup


To use `icon-sync`, you must provide a GitHub Access Token. There are two options depending on your preference and security requirements:


Option 1: Personal Access Token (Classic)

If you're using a Personal Access Token, make sure to grant the repo.


⚠️ This approach is simple but grants broad access to your repositories. Use with caution if you have sensitive data or multiple repositories under the same account.


Option 2: Fine-Grained Personal Access Token (Recommended)

If you're using a Fine-Grained Access Token, you'll need to specify individual repository permissions, Make sure to select the following:


Contents → `Read and write`

Allows access to files and blobs in the repository, which is required for uploading icons.


Metadata → `Read-only`

Allows the plugin to retrieve basic repository information.


Pull Requests → `Read and write`

Enables the plugin to automatically create and update pull requests.


5. Usage

Once installed and configured, using `icon-sync` is straightforward.


Step 1: Environment Setup

After launching the `icon-sync` plugin, navigate to the **GitHub** tab.


You’ll see several input fields you need to fill out:

Owner – your GitHub username or organization name

API Key – your GitHub access token

Main Branch Name – usually `main` or `master`

Compare Branch Name – a branch to create for the pull request (e.g., `icon/update`)

Repository Name – the target GitHub repository

Store Path – the directory in the repo where icons should be stored (e.g., `icons/`)


Once you complete these fields, you’re ready to import icons.


Note: These settings are saved locally after the first setup, so you won’t need to re-enter them every time you open the plugin.


Step 2: Import Icons from Figma

You have **two options** to import icons from your Figma file:


Option 1: Auto-Import from Current Page

As soon as the plugin launches, it will automatically scan the **current Figma page** and import all icons that are structured as components.


Option 2: Frame-Based Import

Alternatively, you can:


1. Create a Frame in your Figma file.

2. Select the Frame.

3. Click the "Import Icons" button in the plugin.


This will import only the icons within the selected Frame.


Step 3: Deploy to GitHub

Once you've finished both steps above, you're ready to deploy your icons to GitHub.


Click the Deploy button to start the upload process.

`icon-sync` will automatically commit the icons and open a pull request in your repository.

After deployment, a "Go to GitHub" button will appear. Click it to jump directly to the pull request and review the changes.
131205.tagline: Sync icons from Figma to GitHub

plugins.name: Naming Helper
plugins.description:
# Naming Helper - 피그마 플러그인


선택된 프레임(들) 내의 모든 요소 이름을 한 번에 변경할 수 있는 피그마 플러그인입니다.


## 기능


- 선택된 프레임 내의 모든 하위 요소 이름을 일괄 변경

- 여러 프레임을 동시에 선택하여 일괄 처리 가능

- 현재 선택된 프레임 개수 표시

- 프레임이 선택되지 않았을 경우 알림 제공


## 사용 방법


1. 이름을 변경하고자 하는 프레임(들)을 선택합니다.

2. 플러그인을 실행합니다.

3. 입력 필드에 새로운 이름을 입력합니다.

4. "이름 변경하기" 버튼을 클릭합니다.

5. 프레임 내의 모든 요소 이름이 변경됩니다.
plugins.tagline: Naming Helper

plugins.name: Link Manager
plugins.description:
Figma でのリンク管理に悩んでいませんか？


デザイン内のリンクが散らばっていて、手作業で整理するのが大変…。

Link Manager を使えば、リンクの検出・削除が数クリックで完了！

リンクの整理をもっと簡単に。スッキリとしたデザイン管理 を実現しましょう！🚀


Managing links in Figma can be frustrating—especially when working on large projects with scattered hyperlinks.


With Link Manager, you can effortlessly find, copy, and remove links from your Figma files in just a few clicks.


No more clutter, no more manual cleanups. Keep your designs neat, organized, and efficient with this powerful yet easy-to-use plugin! 🚀


🔹 主な機能 | Key Features


✅ 🔍 自動リンク検出 | Auto-Detect Hyperlinks – 選択したフレーム内の すべてのリンクを瞬時にリストアップ

✅ 🗑 簡単なリンク削除 | Easy Link Removal – 選択したリンクを削除 or すべてのリンクを一括削除

✅ 🌍 多言語対応 | Multi-language Support – 英語 & 日本語 に対応



🔹 使い方 | How to Use


🇯🇵 日本語

1️⃣ 「Detect Links」 をクリック → デザイン内のリンクをリストアップ

2️⃣ 「Remove Selected」 で 選択したリンクを削除

3️⃣ 「Remove All」 ですべてのリンクを一括削除


💡 Figma 内のリンク管理をスマートに！


🇬🇧 English

1️⃣ Click “Detect Links” to scan your Figma file for all hyperlinks

2️⃣ Select specific links and click “Remove Selected” to delete them

3️⃣ Click “Remove All” to erase every hyperlink from your design


💡 Easily manage hyperlinks in Figma with just a few clicks!



🎯 こんな方におすすめ | Who is This Plugin For?


🇯🇵 日本語

🔹 デザイナー - Figma ファイルを整理したい

🔹 チーム - Figma でリンクを共有・管理するプロジェクトに最適

🔹 開発者 - デザインからすべてのリンクを抽出したい

🔹 プロジェクトマネージャー - レビュー時にリンクを整理したい

🔹 リンクを手軽に管理したいすべてのユーザー！


🇺🇸 English

🔹 UI/UX Designers - Keep your Figma files structured

🔹 Teams - Perfect for projects with shared links

🔹 Developers - Extract all links from a design efficiently

🔹 Project Managers - Easily organize links during reviews

🔹 Anyone who wants hassle-free hyperlink management!
plugins.tagline: Easily manage hyperlinks in Figma with just a few clicks!

plugins.name: Lock All Ratios
plugins.description:
### Features


Base on the new official figma feature Aspect Ratio Locked


- 🖼️ **Batch Operations**: Lock/unlock aspect ratios of multiple images with one click

- 🔍 **Smart Filtering**:

- Filter by ratio: Quickly find images with the same aspect ratio

- Filter by lock state: Easily distinguish between locked and unlocked images

- 👀 **Preview Features**:

- Thumbnail previews

- Display image dimensions and ratios

- Click to locate images on canvas

- 🌐 **Bilingual**: Supports both English and Chinese interfaces


### Use Cases

- When maintaining consistent image ratios

- Processing large numbers of image resources

- Organizing and checking image ratios

- Quickly locating images with specific ratios


### How to Use

1. Select images to process

2. Use top filters to filter images as needed

3. Operate individually or in batch

4. Click image thumbnails or names to locate them on canvas


### Quick Operations

- Select/Deselect All: Use the checkbox in the table header

- Quick Filter: Use the ratio and lock state filters at the top

- Batch Operations: Use "Lock All"/"Unlock All" buttons in the bottom toolbar

- Refresh List: Use the refresh button in the bottom toolbar


---


基于 figma 新发布的 “图片比例锁定” 功能开发


### 功能特点

- 🖼️ **批量操作**：一键锁定/解锁多个图片的宽高比

- 🔍 **智能筛选**：

- 按比例筛选：快速找到相同比例的图片

- 按锁定状态筛选：轻松区分已锁定和未锁定的图片

- 👀 **预览功能**：

- 缩略图预览

- 显示图片尺寸和比例

- 点击可快速定位到画布中的图片

- 🌐 **双语支持**：支持中文和英文界面


### 使用场景

- 需要保持多个图片比例一致时

- 批量处理大量图片资源时

- 整理和检查图片比例时

- 快速定位特定比例的图片


### 使用方法

1. 选择要处理的图片

2. 使用顶部筛选器按需过滤图片

3. 可以单个操作，也可以批量选择后操作

4. 点击图片缩略图或名称可快速定位到画布中的图片


### 快捷操作

- 全选/取消全选：使用表格顶部的复选框

- 快速筛选：使用顶部的比例和锁定状态筛选器

- 批量操作：使用底部工具栏的 " 锁定全部 "/" 解锁全部 " 按钮

- 刷新列表：使用底部工具栏的刷新按钮

accepted.name: RyanHuang 👀
accepted.description:
🔸 Product Designer
🔸 Heavy user of Figma
🔸 Beginner in FE

plugins.name: MAPPE — Mini map for Figma
plugins.description:
The figma area (if we take the entire canvas) is 262,000 x 262,000 pixels. If there are few screens and they are small, you do not think about the actual canvas size. But when there are a lot of layouts, at some point you run into the edge of the canvas. At this point, you understand that it becomes impossible to navigate in figma.


MAPPE makes navigation in big files easier. The plugin shows where are you exactly on the canvas.

plugins.name: Condens
plugins.description:
With the Condens plugin, you can quickly import highlights from Condens into FigJam. This keeps your insights intact, preserving key details like participant names and links back to the original data.


Perfect for brainstorming, organizing ideas, and running synthesis workshops with your team — without losing the context behind your research, even when switching between tools.


How it works:

  1. Export your highlights from Condens as a CSV file.
  2. Open the Condens plugin in FigJam and upload the CSV file.
  3. Your Highlights are instantly converted into sticky notes, complete with the respondent’s name and a direct link back to the original data in Condens, ready to use in your FigJam board.


Contact us for support, book a demo to get a personalized walkthrough, or visit our Help Center for more information.

If you're not using Condens yet, start your free 15-day trial at condens.io.

plugins.name: Tazym
plugins.description:
Introducing Tazym, the ultimate Figma plugin that streamlines the design-to-web process. With Tazym, you can effortlessly upload your designs to the cloud, generating a unique URL that allows you to update your design in Figma in real-time. Say goodbye to manual website updates or the need to rely on developers. With Tazym, you are the creator, and you own your designs.


Getting started with Tazym is easy. Simply select your design, name it, choose a format (SVG, PNG, or JPG), and voila - you have a URL that can be used anywhere to showcase your work. When inspiration strikes and you want to make updates, it's as easy as editing in Figma and hitting the Update button in Tazym. Your users will see your latest creations instantly.


Ready to take control of your designs and streamline your workflow? Visit tazym.com to learn more and start using Tazym today!
plugins.tagline: Export your Figma designs to URLs. Edit them any time.

plugins.name: Smart Selection
plugins.description:
Smart Selection is a powerful tool for designers that allows flexible filtering of elements based on multiple parameters: dimensions, names, types, properties, and even child element content.


The plugin enables you to:

  1. Filter elements by exact values, ranges, and regular expressions
  2. Find objects with specific child elements
  3. Save, load, and combine sets of selected elements
  4. Export and import selection sets to share between files and teams
  5. Use an intuitive interface with convenient filters


Essential for working with complex designs when you need to quickly find elements with specific characteristics — save time on routine selection tasks and start working more efficiently.
plugins.tagline: Advanced element selection by parameters and saving selection sets for quick reuse.

plugins.name: QR Code Figma
plugins.description:
QR Code Generator for Figma


Create beautiful, customizable QR codes directly in Figma with this powerful plugin. Perfect for designers, marketers, and developers who need to quickly generate and place QR codes in their designs.


Features

✨ Instant Generation

- Generate QR codes in seconds

- Support for URLs, text, and more

- Real-time preview


🎨 Full Customization

- Custom colors for both foreground and background

- Adjustable size and margin

- Multiple border styles (solid, dashed, none)

- Custom border width

- Dark/Light mode support


🖼️ Logo Integration

- Add your brand logo to QR codes

- Automatic logo sizing and positioning

- Maintain QR code readability


📱 Multiple Formats

- PNG and JPEG export options

- High-quality output

- Optimized for both print and digital


📋 History & Management

- Save your recent QR codes

- Quick access to previous designs

- Easy history management


Use Cases

- Marketing materials

- Business cards

- Product packaging

- Event tickets

- Digital menus

- Social media graphics

- Print materials

- Website designs


How to Use

1. Enter your text or URL

2. Customize the appearance

3. Add your logo (optional)

4. Generate the QR code

5. Place it directly in your design

6. Download or export as needed


Perfect For

- Designers creating marketing materials

- Marketers adding QR codes to campaigns

- Developers needing QR codes for apps

- Businesses creating branded QR codes

- Anyone who needs professional QR codes quickly


Note: This plugin requires an active internet connection to generate QR codes.
plugins.tagline: Create, Customize & Generate QR Codes in Seconds - Right in Figma!
